author: Darren Boey
title: Citic Securities Leads Brokerage Slump Amid China Stock Rout
text:
Citic Securities Co. shares tumbled more than 20 percent in Hong Kong, leading a plunge among Chinese brokerages, as the nation’s stock market extended its rout.
Citic, China’s largest brokerage, sank 15 percent, the most since January, to HK$17.84 as of 9:56 a.m. Hong Kong time Wednesday, after slumping 23 percent earlier. GF Securities Co. and Haitong International Securities Group Ltd. tumbled at least 19 percent.
The brokerages fell as the Shanghai Composite Index tumbled as much as 8.2 percent amid concern a raft of measures to stabilize equities is failing to stop China’s bear-market rout. The gauge has slumped 31 percent from its June peak.
“This is scary,” Edmond Law, a Hong Kong-based analyst with UOB-Kay Hian Holdings Ltd., said by phone. “Investors are panicking because there are too many uncertainties. China’s stock-market plunge shows that there’s not much more the government could do to save the market.”
